requirements.summary: Show a one-time-per-load full-screen logo splash overlay that pops in, fades out, then reveals the page content (respecting prefers-reduced-motion).
acceptanceCriteria: On initial page load, the user sees a full-screen splash overlay with the logo centered before any of the page sections are visible.
The logo performs a short pop animation (scale-in / scale-up feel) and the splash then fades out smoothly.
After the fade-out completes, the splash overlay is removed/hidden and the normal page becomes visible and usable.
The splash runs once per page load (refresh triggers it again; client-side interactions do not re-trigger it).
If the user has prefers-reduced-motion enabled, the splash does not animate (or uses a near-instant transition) and content is revealed quickly.
The splash uses the existing logo asset already referenced in the app (currently /assets/IMG_20260211_212234_800.jpg) and does not introduce a new required image.

file_operations.description: Create a reusable SplashOverlay component that renders a fixed full-screen overlay with the existing logo (/assets/IMG_20260211_212234_800.jpg), coordinates pop-then-fade timing, and supports prefers-reduced-motion to skip/shorten animations.

Wire SplashOverlay into the app so it appears on initial load, sits above all content, and prevents the underlying page sections from being visible/interactive until the splash finishes; ensure it runs once per full page load and does not re-trigger on in-app interactions.

requirements.summary: Add Tailwind/CSS animation utilities for splash pop and fade-out without breaking existing hero fade-in animations.
acceptanceCriteria: The splash animations are implemented via project styling (Tailwind config and/or global CSS) and are reusable and named clearly.
Existing page animations (e.g., current animate-fade-in usage) still work as before.
No console errors occur due to missing animation classes or misconfigured Tailwind build.

file_operations.description: Add clearly named keyframes/animation entries for the splash pop and splash fade-out effects (distinct from existing fade-in) so they are reusable and do not conflict with the current animate-fade-in used in the hero section.

Add any required global utility classes (e.g., animation fill-mode/forwards support) and reduced-motion-friendly defaults for the splash animations, ensuring existing global styling and current fade-in behavior remain unchanged.
